fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Euclidean space \mathbb {R}^n is topologized as the product of \mathbb {R}.
A graduate-level textbook that presents basic topology from the perspective of category theory.
The Euclidean topology on \mathbb {R} is the topology generated by the open intervals (a, b).
A product is a limit of a discrete diagram. Its legs are called projections.
